newsitem.title: INDONESIA: PRESS DIGEST - Indonesian newspapers - April 1.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Indonesian newspapers - April 1.

text.p: The following are the leading stories in the Indonesian press on April 1. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
President Suharto says he did not come to power as a result of a coup and that his predecessor's mandate was withdrawn in a constitutional way by parliament.
Indonesia's political parties have been granted 500 million rupiah each from the government to pay for their forthcoming election campaigns ahead of the May 29 poll.
President Suharto has defended the government's plan to hold a controversial seminar on the fall of the late President Sukarno by saying his predecessor was replaced by constitutional means.
Investment Minister Sanyoto Sastrowardoyo said foreign direct investment approvals until March 15 this year stood at $6.3 billion, compared with $6.94 billion over the same period last year.
Forestry Minister Djamaloedin Soerjohadikoesoemo has said Indonesia would raise forestry fees for cutting logs by 10 percent from April 1.
